abstract: The chief executive has used personal stakes in Chesapeake’s wells to obtain more than $800 million in private loans. Carl Icahn wants four new directors on the nine-member board.
snippet: The chief executive has used personal stakes in Chesapeake’s wells to obtain more than $800 million in private loans. Carl Icahn wants four new directors on the nine-member board.
lead_paragraph: Carl C. Icahn, the billionaire investor, bought a 7.56 percent stake in the Chesapeake Energy Corporation and demanded a new slate of directors amid growing shareholder concern about the company’s management.

headline.main: Icahn Buys a Stake in Chesapeake Energy
